title: Ticket Tailor are an extremely stable online management system for selling event tickets
name: Gareth S.
pros: Pros: Their system can be used as stand-alone and/or integrates fully with your website and social media customer touch points.Set up of your own box office is relatively easy, but it easier still if you spend time writing all or marketing information and promotional pictures before you log in. Then have everything ready to copy and paste and upload the images. However, you can save your event pages as drafts to return to later, or update at any time.You can set up different methods of payment to suit your requirements and can design the interface to match your brand.Once set up your box office becomes fully automated, so you can check in to your dash board as frequently or infrequently as you wish and check sales and data as you wish.They have an app you can download to your smartphone to be used for checking in, which saves on buying or hiring in barcode scanners and gives great data and feedback on attendance for future events.
cons: Cons: As a small event's organiser, there is not a lot we dislike. The only modification I would like to see is to the monthly payment plan.It jumps from one event payment plan to 5 events. Maybe they could introduce a 2 - 3 event plan?
overall: Overall: Selling and monitoring of event ticket sales can be managed through your website and social media sites and becomes fully automated. It gives you an online booking office and enables the booking procedure UX to be easy to complete and payment can be secure through systems like PayPal. It automatically sends the customer the e-ticket and records their information for you to access at any time, along with sales data that can be invaluable for marketing and setting up other events.You only pay per event or within a selected number of events depending on your payment plan. You pay monthly for the period of sales you want and can stop it at any time.

title: For the independent musicians
name: Edward W.
pros: Pros: I really like the ease of use and how simple it is to setup a store front for tickets. Super quick set up time and very accessible to manage and make quick edits if needed
cons: Cons: I dislike the fact that we cannot customize the look of our tickets and rather are stuck with the default 'QR' coded squares that are the printable 'tickets'. We would like to see something that allows us to be creative with the presentation of our tickets and make them feel like actual concert tickets
overall: Overall: Overall, very pleased with the software and no major qualms other than the ticket customization. Very low learning curve, quick money deposits, relatively inexpensive fees and can always reach out to their team if needed.

title: Best value in event ticketing services
name: Jason D.
pros: Pros: The best thing about Ticket Tailor is the flat fee pricing model. You can charge as much or as little as you want for tickets, and not worry that they are taking a cut of every ticket sold. Especially for expensive tickets, this amounts to hundreds of dollars in savings.
cons: Cons: There are a few use cases that I've come across for which it isn't ideal, but I've contacted the developers and they are very helpful with taking suggestions and offering ideas. I will freely admit that some of my use cases are fairly esoteric, so if you're just doing a fairly normal event you should have no issues.
overall: Overall: Overall we've used TicketTailor for almost 10 events over the past 2 years and love it. It's the cheapest full-featured ticketing system you'll find, and much easier than hosting your own service to save money.

title: Customer service and tickets sales

I also love that ticket tailor do not charge you a fee for setting up and using the service what's amazing is they have a pay as you go serviceSo they take a very small percentage from every ticket sale. I also love how you can choose to set up your personal PayPal link or stripe, great service
cons: Cons: Loved everything! Customer service is amazing!
overall: Overall: I had an overall amazing experience with Ticket tailor I have been with ticket tailor for over 2 years.

title: Ticket Taylor Ticked All My Boxes For Selling Tickets Online For An Event
name: Steve P.
comments: Comments: Having recently being tasked with sorting ticket sales for my old colleges reunion, I searched to see if there was on online ticket solution to my dilemma as the former students were now all over UK/world and I had no direct contact for them.This is where I found Ticket Taylor. On researching other companies of similar attributes, Ticket Taylor came out on top especially in the value for money department.On signing up to the package, I soon found the site very easy to use. You can also SEO the ticket office to suit direct hits for potential online searches.The system is, in my opinion, faultless. It made what a thought would be a cumbersome task into something very delightful.The process of buying a ticket online was simple. I created links from the Facebook page and my website to the online ticket office.I could regularly extrapolate information from the data collected by Ticket Taylor.I found the e-ticketing system very useful indeed.During the use of their system I had little need for help But when I did, their messaging system was simple to use and the small problems I had were dealt with quickly and in a very friendly manor.

title: Stable, Cheap and Customisable
name: Alex M.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: After looking at alternative online ticketing solutions we were initially drawn to TicketTailor by their competitive pricing, but they have proven to be great. Their platform is stable, easy to use and very customisable. They even offer a charity discount on top of their low pricing! We weren't sure about choosing someone other than the brand name for organising events online - let's call them Shiny Events - but TicketTailor have met all our expectations.
cons: Cons: The only inconvenience we've found is that TicketTailor fees are paid to them via credit card, whereas card transaction fees are debited by their payment provider (Stripe) from the remittance. This has caused our accounts team a few challenges as the bank account we're having the remittance paid into isn't the same as the bank account with a credit card! Not a show stopper, but upset our finance team a little!

Our only concern was that even after we ended our event, we got billed for two more months. We were not aware of the charges until the banking statment arrived. Ticket Tailor gave us store credit and did give us a prorated refund on the partial month based on when we notified them. We think there should be a clear explanation of how to prevent this from happening once the event has ended. Other than that we were happy with the whole service.
